text: <@UKJSMBW6A> there's always the option to use the form submit JS API (which doesn't require authorization) build your own form with whatever you'd like and just post the data to HubSpot
yeah, i know that, but building an entirely custom form just to support zip code field validation seems like re-inventing the wheel a bit when it could be solved in-product in numerous ways
and if you build a custom form - you lose all those nice bells/whistles like field prefill, dependency fields, smart fields etc...
